ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is an introduction to the physics principles that underlie a variety of biological processes and phenomena. I would recommend the class to another student, because I think it is a useful additional perspective for understanding biological problems.
Would recommend for one with a fairly developed background in matlab and interested in

Interesting course that covers a lot of important topics in biophysics. Even if students have the corresponding knowledge, the course allows them to think in a different perspective, whether if they have a background in biology or physics. More theoretical / coding based, but somewhat relaxing.

I would recommend this course if you are interested in doing modeling work. If programming is not your thing, I would expect this course would be tedious and unpleasant at best. That said, if you wanted to learn programming, this course would be a great "trial by fire" way of getting your hands dirty with matlab.
I would totally recommend this course. Specially for someone who enjoy's coding.
Computationally heavy class but overall I found that beneficial which is why I would recommend it.
I would definitely recommend this class to anybody who is interested in simulating biophysical models in molecular biology or biochemistry.
If you are interested in biology or materials science from a computational/simulation perspective, take this! Make sure you are familiar with MatLab beforehand.
yes. good. should know physics to really get alot out of it

I would recommend the course because I think that the course material is interesting and covers a nice range of biophysical questions. It serves as a very effective introductory course to biological questions that can be answered using different tools.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Allows me to think in a different perspective, while widens my knowledge in certain topics
It wasnt quite related to what i do, nevertheless, a great course.
Its definitely helped me feel more confident in my programming abilities so I would say that has helped.
Very interesting from a computational biology persepctive. Helped me better understand some of my previous coursework/research.
